result.execSummary:
The defendant Faviel Gonzalez-Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. If defendant is deported, he may not reenter the United States unless it is legally or with a Visa. No contact with any known drug dealers or users. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling.  Transcript filed 9-30-16. Defendant Faviel  Gonzalez-Sanchez in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Faviel  Gonzalez-Sanchez in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Spanish Interpreter Rick Kissell present and sworn.  

State has no additions or corrections to PSI.
Defense indicates page 12, substance usage history, contains an error (he was in custody in August of 2016), and on page 15, defendant actually plead to count 2.

State requests 4 years WPS (3 IC & 1 ES) deportation and not allowed to return to US illegally.
Defense supplied letter from defendant's employer, and requests time served or time recommended by PSI writer. 

BTC:  3 years WPS (2 years IC & 1 year ES)
No contact with Rodolfo Rebollar, Reynaldo Alvarez-Rebollar or any other known drug users or dealers
If deported, not to re-enter US unless legally or with VISA
No alcohol or controlled substances
full time employment
eligible for CIP & SAT.
DNA sample if not already on file
firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA surcharge
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with calculation.

If the Court allows the State's motion to adjourn, Mr. Gamez wishes to enter a speedy trial demand.

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(cm)4-PCS w/intent - Cocaine; Ct 2: 961.41(1m)(h)2-PCS w/intent - THC, Ct 3: 961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, R.A.R. & R.R.   Make all court appearances on time.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Faviel  Gonzalez-Sanchez in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Faviel  Gonzalez-Sanchez in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense motions the Court to obtain copies of sealed search warrants. The State has submitted an order to the Court allowing release of same.
Defense asks to be heard on bond and requests a more reasonable bond under $1,000.000.00 as it is set now. Defense suggest $10,000.00 - $20,000.00 cash. Defense indicates that they do not oppose GPS monitoring. The State objects - puts argument on the record regarding deft's conviction and subsequent prison sentence. Deft was deported and has illegally re-entered this country.

BTC: The Court has signed the orders and the copies will be provided to defense and the State. Bond modification is granted. Bond is to be reduced to $500,000.00. Same terms and conditions as previously stated.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
